workflow.title: zetasizer2excel
workflow.description:
Arrrgh! The exported data file format for the Malvern Zetasizer is insane!

Row1, x1,x2,x3,x4,....,y1,y2,y3,y4,....
Row2, x1,x2,x3,x4,....,y1,y2,y3,y4,....
Row3, x1,x2,x3,x4,....,y1,y2,y3,y4,....

This workflow imports the txt file, takes each row and reformats as table with 3 columns: Size, Intensity, Volume. Then exports the data for each row to a new tab in Excel. Or you can just use KNIME to plot and prepare reports (to do).

The TableRow2Variable node allows you to name the tabs in Excel from a Column in KNIME. If you use the SampleName column, be aware that Excel truncates the tab name to the first 31 characters, so your tabs WILL be overwritten if you use long sample names.

TO DO: Graph and send to BIRT reports; Send SampleName and summary data to BIRT reports.
